name: language_style
title: Language Style
description: Traditional or Contemporary English

options.name: Contemporary Langauge
options.description: Text in contemporary English according to the 2019 edition of the Book of Common Prayer

options.name: Traditional Language
options.description: Text in tradtional, Elizabethan-style English according to the 2022 Traditional Language Edition of the 2019 edition of the Book of Common Prayer

name: psalm_translation
title: Psalms Translation
description: The Psalms Translation for use in the Daily Office

options.name: Contemporary Language
options.description: The New Coverdale Psalter, a contemporary language adaptation of the 1535 Coverdale Psalter, as introducted in the 2019 Book of Common Prayer

options.name: Traditional Language
options.description: The Coverdale Psalter, the traditional language psalter from 1535 (with minor edits in 1928), as found in the Traditional Language Edition of the 2019 Book of Common Prayer

name: bible_translation
title: Bible Translation
description: The Bible Translation used for the readings

options.name: ESV
options.description: English Standard Version (2001)

options.name: KJV
options.description: The King James Version (Authorized Edition) (1611) (traditional language)

options.name: RSV
options.description: Revised Standard Version (1946)

options.name: NASB
options.description: New American Standard Bible (1971/2020)

options.name: NRSV
options.description: New Revised Standard Version (1989)

options.name: NAB-RE
options.description: New American Bible (Revised Edition) (2011)

name: psalter
title: Psalter Cycle
description: During Morning and Evening Prayer, pray through all the Psalms either every 60 days (fewer psalms per day) or once every 30 days (more psalms per day).

options.name: 60 Day
options.description: Pray through the psalms once every 60 days

options.name: 30 Day
options.description: Pray through the psalms once every 30 days

name: reading_cycle
title: Reading Cycle
description: Read through most of the Bible during Morning and Evening Prayer every 1 year or every 2 years. The one year cycle is best if you do both Morning and Evening prayer daily; the two year cycle is best if you do only one.

options.name: One Year
options.description: Read through most of the Bible each year. (Use if you pray both Morning and Evening Prayer)

options.name: Two Year
options.description: Read through most of the Bible in two years. (Use if you pray either Morning or Evening prayer)

name: reading_length
title: Reading Length
description: Always use the full readings, or use the shortened readings (when there are suggested abbreviations).

options.name: Full
options.description: The full readings will always be used.

options.name: Abbreviated
options.description: Suggested abbreviations, when available.

name: reading_audio
title: Reading Audio
description: Show or hide an audio player to listen to the scripture readings during Morning and Evening Prayer.  Audio is provided by esv.org and currently does not include the Deuterocanon/Apocrypha.

options.name: Disable Audio
options.description: No audio controls for scripture readings

options.name: Enable Audio
options.description: Enable audio player for scripture readings

options.name: Traditional
options.description: The traditional fixed canticles each day

options.name: Seasonal Rotation
options.description: One fixed canticle and one canticle that rotates by season

options.name: Daily Rotation
options.description: A rotating set of canticles by day of week and season

name: psalm_style
title: Psalm Style
description: Psalm Recitation Style

options.name: Antiphonally by Whole Verse
options.description: Alternating between leader and congregation by whole verse

options.name: Antiphonally by Half Verse
options.description: Alternating between leader and congregation by half verse

options.name: In Unison
options.description: All verses read in unison

name: lectionary
title: Substitute Sunday/Holy Day (Eucharistic) Lectionary
description: On Sundays and major holy days, do you want to use the standard Daily Office readings or substitute the 3-year Sunday/Holy Day cycle? When the Daily Office is used for the principal service of a church, the prayer book instructs you to replace the Daily Office readings with the three year cycle of Sunday and Holy Day readings.  This is generally done only in churches and not when using the Daily Office as a personal devotion at home.

name: confession
title: Confession Intro Length
description: Use either the short or long exhortation before the confession.

options.name: Long Intro Only on Fast Days
options.description: The long form of the intro and absolution are used only on fast days

options.name: Short Intro Always
options.description: The short form of the intro and absolution are used every day

options.name: Long Intro Always
options.description: The long form of the intro and absolution are used every day

name: absolution
title: Absolution Style
description: After the confession, read an absolution suitable for a priest or a prayer suitable for a deacon or lay person.

options.name: Deacon or Lay Person
options.description: A prayer suitable for a deacon or lay person to read

options.name: Priest or Bishop
options.description: An absolution suitable for a priest to pronounce

name: morning_prayer_invitatory
title: Morning Prayer Invitatory
description: Open with the Venite (Psalm 95) always (traditional), have a special celebratory invitatory on Sundays and feasts (Pascha Nostrum during Eastertide or Jubilate/Psalm 100 otherwise), or rotate between the normal and celebratory invitatory each day. Regardless of which setting you choose, the Pascha Nostrum is always used during the first week of Easter, and the invitatory will never be the same as one of the day's appointed psalms.

options.name: Venite always
options.description: Always use the Venite (except on days when Pslam 95 is appointed)

options.name: Celebratory Sundays and feasts
options.description: Use the Jubilate on Feasts and Sundays, Venite on other days

options.name: Rotating each day
options.description: Rotate between the Venite and Jubilate

options.name: Celebratory Always
options.description: Always use the Jubilate (or Pascha Nostrum, in Eastertide)

name: reading_headings
title: Reading Headings
description: Show or hide headings from the English Standard Version of the Bible in scripture readings

options.name: Hide
options.description: Hide ESV headings in readings

options.name: Show
options.description: Show ESV headings in readings

name: language_style_for_our_father
title: Language Style for Kyrie and Our Father
description: When the overall language style is 'contemporary', both traditional and contemporary language options are available for the Kyrie (Lord have mercy) and the Lord's Prayer. The setting has no effect when the overal language style is set to 'tradtional'.

options.name: Traditional
options.description: Traditional language for the Kyrie and Our Father

options.name: Contemporary
options.description: Modern language for the Kyrie and Our Father

name: national_holidays
title: National Holiday Collects
description: Show country-specific commemorations for the United States, Canada, or both.

options.name: All
options.description: Both U.S. and Canadian Holidays

options.name: United States
options.description: United States Holidays

options.name: Canada
options.description: Canadian Holidays

options.name: None
options.description: No Holidays

name: suffrages
title: Evening Prayer Suffrages
description: Choose which set of short prayers to be used each evening

options.name: Rotating
options.description: Rotate between the traditional and new set each day

options.name: Traditional
options.description: Always use the traditional set (same as Morning Prayer)

options.name: New
options.description: Always use the newer set, each ending with "We entreat you, O Lord"

name: collects
title: Additional Collects
description: Use a different collect for each day of the week, or use the same two collects (from the classic prayer books) each day.

options.name: Rotating
options.description: A different collect is said for each day of the week

options.name: Fixed
options.description: The two traditional collects are said every day

name: mp_great_litany
title: Great Litany at Morning Prayer
description: Include the Great Litany after the collects at Morning Prayer

options.name: Off
options.description: Do not use the litany

options.name: Wed, Fri, & Sun.
options.description: Litany on Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday (the traditional days)

options.name: Everyday
options.description: Litany every day

name: ep_great_litany
title: Great Litany at Evening Prayer
description: Include the Great Litany after the collects at Evening Prayer

options.name: Off
options.description: Do not use the litany

options.name: Wed, Fri, & Sun.
options.description: Litany on Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday (the traditional days)

options.name: Everyday
options.description: Litany every day

name: general_thanksgiving
title: General Thanksgiving
description: Pray the General Thanksgiving at the end of Morning and Evening Prayer

options.name: On
options.description: Add the prayer of general thanksgiving at the end of the office

options.name: Off
options.description: Hide the prayer of general thanksgiving at the end of the office

name: chrysostom
title: Prayer of St. John Chrysostom
description: Pray the Prayer of St. John Chrysostom at the end of Morning and Evening Prayer.  This prayer is suitable when praying in a group.

options.name: On
options.description: For use when praying in groups of two or more

options.name: Off
options.description: For when praying individually

name: grace
title: The Grace
description: Rotate each day through the three provided conclusions, or always use the same one from the classic prayer books.

options.name: Rotating
options.description: Rotate through three different verses daily

options.name: Traditional
options.description: Conclude with the traditional grace each day

name: o_antiphons
title: Advent "O" Antiphons
description: The traditional "O" Antiphons are used before and after the first canticle in Evening Prayer during the last eight days of Advent. You can use literal translations of the original Latin, or the familiar paraphrases used in the hymn "O Come, O Come Emmanuel"

options.name: Literal
options.description: Literal translation of the original Latin

options.name: Latin
options.description: Original Latin

options.name: None
options.description: Hide the antiphons

options.name: Hymnal
options.description: Paraphrase used in, O Come, O Come Emmanuel

options.name: Brief
options.description: A brief scripture reading appointed for the time of day

options.name: Long
options.description: A longer scripture reading from the continuous lectionary

name: family_reading_audio
title: Reading Audio
description: Show or hide an audio player to listen to the scripture readings during Morning and Evening Prayer.  Audio is provided by esv.org and currently does not include the Deuterocanon/Apocrypha.

options.name: Disable Audio
options.description: No audio controls for scripture readings

options.name: Enable Audio
options.description: Enable audio player for scripture readings

options.name: By Time of Day
options.description: The prayer appointed for the time of day from Family Prayer

options.name: By Day of Week
options.description: The prayer appointed for the day of the week from the Daily Office

options.name: By Day of the Year
options.description: The prayer appointed for the specific day of the year (or the previous Sunday if there is no feast)

name: family-opening-sentence
title: Opening Sentence
description: Use the same opening sentences each day based on the time of the day, or use the seasonal options from the Daily Office

options.name: Fixed by Time of Day
options.description: An opening sentence based on the time of day

options.name: Seasonal
options.description: An opening sentence based on the season

name: family-creed
title: Apostles' Creed
description: Include the Apostle's Creed before the prayers during 'In the Morning' and 'In the Early Evening' Family Prayer

options.name: No
options.description: No creed

options.name: Yes
options.description: Include Creed
